acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 72 hours EC50=0.39mg/L of the algae (Green Algae) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal roue) value of >5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1985)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of 0.8mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1991)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a liquid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 1,077mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible in the absence of existing classification, though the substance was suspected of causing an increase in rat-specific tumor incidence in the available carcinogenicity studies in rats and mice (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986, 1989)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (log Kow=3.37(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 154.5degC (open cup flash test) (HSDB (2006)).

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vivo studies (mouse micronucleus tests and rat chromosome aberration tests) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1985, 1987)). The in vitro mutagenicity studies (chromosome aberration tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1985)) and reverse mutation tests in bacteria (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987)) yielded weak positive results.

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine (but not fluorine and oxygen), with the chlorine bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Considered non-pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures since the substance is stable to heat (up to 165degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction or offspring development observed in rat 3-generation reproduction studies and rat/mouse teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Stable to heat (up to 165degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of irritation reactions (Draize score of 1.7), with some improvement occurring during 72 hours of observation, observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including increased liver weights and hepatic tissue lesions (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including tremors, piloerection, sedation, debility and convulsions (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1985)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.
